intro: Dicrastylis gilesii f. brevipila, commonly known as the short-stemmed burr grass, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The species is characterized by its compact growth habit and small, clustered inflorescences. It typically thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in coastal and inland areas. Its botanical features make it an important component of local flora and an indicator of specific environmental conditions.
